poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Fair's fair or fair enough:
You flag a taxi, you pay the fare.
If the driver's bad, call a skinner
To peel him alive from the flair of his nostrils
To the curl of his toes. Some poets drool on that
Vellum, ready-printed in reverse
And the blow-up doll they can send off
On a methane flare.
